document_data.name: Rock Cake
document_data.basicrefs: {{Cite polyhedron/51/The Living City: The Downunda Patisserie|17}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Rock cakes''' were a type of small handfood pastry, which were favored by [[dwarves]] of the city of [[Ravens Bluff]] and [[the Vast]].
document_data.History: Rock cakes were a daily morning staple baked at the [[Downunda Patisserie]] in the [[Crow's End]] District of Ravens Bluff. Plain rock cakes were sold for a single [[silver]] [[coin|piece]]. However, when the fancy struck, [[Jemima Chisolm]], the bakery's cook, whipped out a special batch, smothered in dwarvish liquor icing, which sold for three [[gold]] pieces.
